edu.rit.m2mp
Class Protocol

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mp.Protocol
public class Protocol
extends Object

Class Protocol encapsulates the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP). To use M2MP:

  1. Create an M2MP channel object (an instance of a class that implements interface Channel) representing the underlying communication medium.

  2. Create an instance of class Protocol, specifying the M2MP channel object.

  3. To send an outgoing M2MP message, call createOutgoingMessage() to create an outgoing message object. You can create as many outgoing message objects as you want. See class OutgoingMessage for further instructions.

  4. To receive incoming M2MP messages, call createIncomingMessageNotifier() to create an incoming message notifier object. You can create as many incoming message notifier objects as you want. See class IncomingMessageNotifier for further instructions.

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Constructor Detail

Protocol

public Protocol(Channel theChannel,
                long theKey1,
                long theKey2,
                int theBufferCount,
                long theTimeoutInterval)
Construct a new M2MP protocol instance. This protocol instance will use the given M2MP channel to send and receive messages. The sequence generator for message IDs is seeded with the given key values; for example, these could be a unique device identifier like an Ethernet MAC address and a unique timestamp like System.currentTimeMillis(). The maximum number of packet buffers that will be allocated is specified so as not to consume unbounded storage. The inter-packet timeout interval — the maximum time interval permitted between reception of sequential packets in a message — is specified; if a message times out, an I/O error is reported for that message.

Parameters:
theChannel - M2MP channel.
theKey1 - First key value.
theKey2 - Second key value.
theBufferCount - Maximum number of packet buffers that will be allocated for use by this M2MP protocol instance.
theTimeoutInterval - Inter-packet timeout interval (milliseconds).
Throws:
NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theChannel is null.
IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theBufferCount is less than or equal to 0. Thrown if theTimeoutInterval is less than or equal to 0.
Method Detail

createOutgoingMessage

public OutgoingMessage createOutgoingMessage(ChannelAddress theDestination)
Create an outgoing message to be transmitted to the given destination. The message is sent via this M2MP protocol instance’s channel.

Note: Some M2MP channel implementations always send packets to the same place, such as a broadcast medium. In that case theDestination is ignored. See the channel implementation documentation for further information.

Parameters:
theDestination - Where to send the outgoing message.
Returns:
Outgoing message.

createIncomingMessageNotifier

public IncomingMessageNotifier createIncomingMessageNotifier()
Create an incoming message notifier. Messages will be received via this M2MP protocol instance’s channel.

Returns:
Incoming message notifier.

getTimeoutInterval

public long getTimeoutInterval()
Returns this M2MP protocol instance’s interpacket timeout interval (milliseconds).

getTimer

public Timer getTimer()
Returns this M2MP protocol instance’s timer. Clients can use this timer if desired to perform timer tasks.
